events.name: Big Data Turns 5
events.description: Join Michael Horn, Managing Director of Data Science at digital agency Huge, for a discussion about how big data will continue to change businesses, impact our jobs, and fuel the transition to fully AI-enabled commerce. Snacks and drinks will be served! Location: Huge's office is located at 33 Ann Siang Rd., Suite 31A. When you arrive, please check in with staff at the building entrance.   About the speaker: Michael Horn (Managing Director, Data Sciences) is responsible for Huge’s Analytics and Data Science offering across the global network of offices. He brings nearly 20 years of media, site and brand measurement experience for clients, including a significant number of Fortune 100 marketers.  Michael was most recently the Chief Analytics Officer of Resonate, one of the most advanced consumer research and activation platforms in the U.S. Earlier in his career, he held various management roles at Universal McCann in their Decision Sciences unit, as well as other senior roles at agencies spanning McGarry Bowen, OMD and R/GA.
events.location: Huge Singapore, 33 Ann Siang Rd, Suite 31A

events.name: Design Innovation Dialogue
events.description: The Design Innovation Singapore community will come together every month to chat, socialise and have a dialogue about topics such as Human-centred Design, Design Thinking in different industries, Creativity in Teams and Innovation Practices in Organisations. We welcome all creatives, innovators, startup entrepreneurs, technologists, consultants, bankers, educators, policy makers and everyone interested in Design Innovation in Singapore. Come and meet an interdisciplinary group, make the right connections and build the Design Innovation community Singapore. See you from 7 pm.

events.name: On-going: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group
events.description: Study group for the Coursera Functional Programming in Scala Specialization, and all of it's courses.  Anyone may attend regardless of your progress in the courses.  We're here to help. If you have not already, please make sure that you have signed up for the courses you are interested in, on Coursera. <a>Functional Programming in Scala5-course Specialization·École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne</a> It's a good idea to have your development environment set up, before attending.  You can find instructions within the courses themselves.
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: WordPress Meetup (July 2016)
events.description:
How to select a web host for your WordPress site?By Jon Ang - WordPress Core Component Maintainer & Admin and Co-Founder, Wingz Communications How do I choose a good plugin?By Jon Ang - WordPress Core Component Maintainer & Admin and Co-Founder, Wingz Communications  Community Open Space:Please comment (below) on topics you would like to discuss, experts & enthusiasts present will answer questions. This will be casual. Possible topics could be - • What makes a good theme?? • My site loads slow, how do I make it faster? • And more (just comment) 

Venue: Microsoft Singapore's building management requires you bring a photo ID for entry into the building. Do join us from 7pm for a 7:30pm start. Please call Jon at[masked] if you have an issue getting to the meetup. Do not abuse the number please :) We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out.  Light refreshments will be provided (likely pizza and soft drinks)
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: July 2016 - Agile Open Space (Embracing Agile)
events.description: Open Space Theme: Embracing Agile More and more companies are seeing the need to become agile to remain competitive. Even our (SG) government is becoming agile. But why? Why is there a need to become agile? Should we embrace it and change or leave it and don't try at all? For this session, come and share your agile journey. Come tell us the stories of your battles and skirmishes, show us your battle scars! (figuratively speaking, of course..); Learn from others the pitfalls of their journeys and how to avoid them! Are you new to agility?  Do you have a burning question? What IS agile? Come over and join us!  Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) Getting Here The SPH News Center is 5 mins walk from Braddell MRT Station, Exit C. Take the pedestrian crossing just after Yellow Pages building to cross over to Toa Payoh North, walk straight down then turn right along the canal to get to Gate 2 (with guard house). Inform our security guard that you're here for the event at Podium block T8.2 and he will guide you to the Podium lobby area. Look out for the signs directing you to the Training Rooms. Drivers can find parking space at the open area car park along Toa Payoh North. Or there's a Multi Storey Carpark at the west tip of Toa Payoh North, behind HDB Block 206. What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology.
events.location: SPH News Center (T8.2/T8.3), 1000 Toa Payoh North Singapore 318994

events.name: Ingesting Data from Kafka to HDFS with Dedupper & Enrichment using JDBC
events.description: Presenter: Dr Sandeep Deshmukh; Committer Apache Apex & DataTorrent Engineer  Abstract:  Ingesting and extracting data from Hadoop can be a frustrating, time consuming activity for many enterprises. Apache Apex Data Ingestion is a standalone big data application that simplifies the collection, aggregation and movement of large amounts of data to and from Hadoop for a more efficient data processing pipeline. Apache Apex Data Ingestion makes configuring and running Hadoop data ingestion and data extraction a point and click process enabling a smooth, easy path to your Hadoop-based big data project. In this series of talks, we would cover how Hadoop Ingestion is made easy using Apache Apex. The second talk in this series would focus on ingesting unbounded data from Kafka to HDFS with couple of processing operators - Transform and enrichment. Please register for the webinar at: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/7322083711883921923 After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar. Apache Apex is a next generation native Hadoop data in motion platform that is being used by customers for both streaming as well as batch processing. Common use cases include ingestion into Hadoop, streaming analytics, ETL, database off-loads, alerts and monitoring, machine model scoring, etc. Apache Apex completely separates operational logic from business logic, and handles all operational aspects. This enables developers to concentrate on business logic and reduce time to market as well as total cost of ownership.  For deeper engagement with Apache Apex - follow ApacheApex, presentations, recordings, download (community, sandbox), Apache Apex releases, docs  This webcast is of Ingest & Transform meetup event done earlier in Pune, IN and we are webcasting it enable other Big Data Ingesters to participate. If you are interested in helping organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) Big Data Ingestion community, please email [masked]
events.group_name: Big Data (Next Gen Hadoop) Ingest & Transform, Singapore
